Reason for 2:
Azure IoT Central is a fully managed IoT app platform that simplifies the creation of IoT solutions. While it can be used for IoT solutions, it is more focused on providing a complete IoT application platform rather than just handling device-to-cloud communication. In this case, the requirement is to input measurement readings from inspection gauges, which can be more efficiently achieved using Azure IoT Hub connector, which is specifically designed for device-to-cloud communication.

IoT hub is also a service for communication between IoT apps and the devices it manages. The difference between IoT hub and IoT central is that IoT is an application platform that simplifies the creation of Internet of Things solutions. IoT central helps to reduce the challenges of implementing IoT development, operations, and management. IoT Central is a fully managed Software as a Service solution. This lowers the bar for entry into the IoT landscape for clients that have limited technical knowledge to manage the IoT stack.

2. IoT Central
IoT Central is SaaS while IoT Hub is PaaS. IoT Hub requires that you have access to software development skills and knowledge because, as a PaaS, it’s more complex in implementation.

Box 1: Assign: Cascade None -
Scenario: Worker skill records must be archived after ten years and are then removed from the main system.
Assign: The referenced table record owner is changed.
Cascade None: Do nothing.
Incorrect Answers:
Cascade All: Perform the action on all referencing table records associated with the referenced table record.

Box 2: Delete: Restrict -
Scenario: Worker information must not be deleted from the system while skill and job placement history records for the worker exist in the system.
Referential, Restrict Delete: In a referential, restrict delete relationship between two tables, you can navigate to any related rows. Actions taken on the parent row will not be applied to the child row, but the parent row cannot be deleted while the child row exists. This is useful if you do not want child rows to become orphaned. This forces the user to delete all of the children before deleting the parent.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powerapps/maker/data-platform/data-platform-entity-lookup
